meanings.definition: A symbol, word, or phrase used to identify a particular company's products and set them apart from competitors.
meanings.sent1: The company's trademarks, like the logo and slogan, help customers recognize their products.
meanings.sent2: It is important for businesses to protect their trademarks to maintain their brand identity.
meanings.sent3: The funny thing is, even my dog can recognize the trademarks on their favorite toys!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a trademark, instantly recognizable and unique.
meanings.sent5: The trademarks of the company were etched in my memory, making me a loyal customer.

meanings.definition: To register a symbol, word, or phrase as a trademark to prevent others from using it.
meanings.sent1: Companies often trademarks their logos to safeguard their brand from copycats.
meanings.sent2: She decided to trademarks her catchphrase to ensure no one else could use it.
meanings.sent3: I trademarked my dance moves so my friends couldn't steal them for themselves!
meanings.sent4: His style of painting was so unique, it was like he had trademarked his own technique.
meanings.sent5: The way she played the guitar was trademarked by her passion and skill.
